title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.16.25 - 30 Part 2 | 01-02-2023
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: In this session we continue to discuss from the verses 25 to 30 of the 16th chapter of the first canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.
segments.summary: The session begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers and an introduction to the verses from Srimad Bhagavatam that will be discussed.

segments.key_quote: So in these verses, 5 verses, 40 of the unlimited number of qualities the Lord has are being enumerated.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the topic of the Lord's unlimited good qualities, mentioning that 40 of these qualities are listed in the verses being discussed, contrasting them with the lack of such qualities in Kali Yuga.

segments.key_quote: Who can describe completely the prowess of Vishnu?
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes the immeasurable nature of Vishnu's prowess, using the example of Trivikrama's expansion to cover the universe and pierce its coverings, allowing the water from the causal ocean to enter this world.

segments.key_quote: Cleanliness means not only external cleanliness, which all of us know, but also internal cleanliness.
segments.summary: The speaker begins to discuss the 40 qualities of the Lord mentioned in the verses, focusing on truthfulness and cleanliness, emphasizing the importance of both external and internal cleanliness, with internal cleanliness being achieved through chanting Hare Krishna.

segments.key_quote: Daya refers to not being able to tolerate another's unhappiness.
segments.summary: The speaker discusses the third quality, 'Daya' or intolerance of another's unhappiness, explaining that it encompasses protection of surrendered souls and well-wishing for devotees, based on Srila Jiva Goswami's teachings.

segments.key_quote: Krishna says don't fear, don't worry about some sinful reactions from the past, I will free you from all those reactions, you simply surrender to me.
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on the Lord's intolerance of suffering, explaining that He protects surrendered souls from sinful reactions, referencing Krishna's assurance in the Bhagavad Gita to provide protection upon surrender.

segments.key_quote: Because they don't surrender and they want to be independent, Krishna does not interfere in their life and therefore they are not particularly protected by the Lord.
segments.summary: The speaker explains why the Lord specifically protects surrendered souls, noting that those who choose independence and do not surrender are not particularly protected, as Krishna does not interfere with their choices.

segments.key_quote: Devotees Krishna maintains completely perfectly in all respects, 100% maintenance, all desires are fulfilled.
segments.summary: The speaker contrasts the general protection provided to all living beings with the complete and perfect maintenance offered to devotees, highlighting that non-devotees are provided for according to the laws of karma, and concludes by announcing the topic for the next session.
